title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (http://contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/

title: Changelog
text: TCGA (20220329 - v37.0) WikiPathways (20230610) CancerMine (v50, 20230301) COMPARTMENTS (2023-05) KEGG (20230330) BioGRID (v4.4.222) Open Targets Platform (2023.02) Cancer Gene Census (v98) Network Cancer Genes (v7.1) MSigDB (v2023.1.Hs) Experimental Factor Ontology (v3.54.0) Human Disease Ontology (2023-05-31) Added Citation Note section output module - key citations Added data licensing terms Documentation & Settings module

title: Changelog
text: TCGA (20221212 - v36.0) WikiPathways (20230210) CancerMine (20230114) COMPARTMENTS (2023-01) KEGG (20230101) Experimental Factor Ontology (v3.50.0) Human Disease Ontology (2023-01-31) Downloading Google Drive can somethis cause trouble due downloading limitations issued Google. alternative approach, one can now download datasets using another host (server hosted University Oslo), argument googledrive = FALSE oncoEnrichR::load_db() Users can opt show isolated nodes (nodes interactions) - logical argument onco_enrich(): ppi_show_isolated_nodes (default FALSE) Users can set minimum required threshold number evidence items required interaction BioGRID New numerical argument onco_enrich(): ppi_biogrid_min_evidence New character argument onco_enrich(): ppi_string_network_type (physical functional) Previous argument ppi_score_threshold now named ppi_string_min_score, scale goes 0 1 (opposed 0-1000 previous versions) Now using regularly updated COMPARTMENTS resource underlying source annotation New arguments onco_enrich(): subcellcomp_min_confidence, subcellcomp_min_channels revised approach assign roles proto-oncogenes tumor suppressors implemented, assign role confidence level (Moderate/Strong/strong) pending upon support manually curated resources (Network Cancer Genes (NCG) Cancer Gene Census (CGC)) support biomedical literature (CancerMine) conservative approach driver gene status implemented: requiring support least two distinct resources (Network Cancer Genes (NCG), Cancer Gene Census, TCGA, IntOGen, CancerMine) ppi_string_min_score ppi_string_network_type ppi_biogrid_min_evidence ppi_show_drugs ppi_show_isolated_nodes regulatory_min_confidence enrichment_p_value_cutoff enrichment_q_value_cutoff enrichment_p_value_adj enrichment_plot_num_terms enrichment_simplify_go enrichment_max_geneset_size enrichment_min_geneset_size subcellcomp_min_confidence subcellcomp_show_cytosol subcellcomp_min_channels added oncoEnrichR favicon output HTML reports

title: Annotation resources
text: Data harvested integrated following resources form backbone oncoEnrichR: Open Targets Platform - human drug-target associations comprehensive disease-target associations CancerMine - literature-mined database drivers, oncogenes tumor suppressors cancer Network Cancer Genes - Network cancer genes - web resource analyze duplicability, orthology network properties cancer genes IntOGen - Compendium mutational driver genes cancer UniProt Cancer Gene Census DoRothEA - gene set resource containing signed transcription factor (TF) - target (regulatory) interactions CellChatDB - ligand-receptor interaction resource Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) - gene aberration frequencies, recurrent point mutations/indels, co-expression patterns ~9,500 primary tumor samples Human Protein Atlas - expression data healthy human tissues (GTex)/cell types, prognostic gene expression associations cancer Molecular Signatures Database (MSigDB) - collection annotated (e.g. towards pathways) genesets enrichment/-representation analysis. includes genesets Gene Ontology, Reactome, KEGG, WikiPathways, BIOCARTA, well curated immunologic cancer-specific signatures. NetPath - signaling transduction pathways Pfam - protein domain database STRING - protein-protein interaction database BioGRID - biomedical interaction repository data compiled comprehensive curation efforts CORUM - protein complex database Compleat - protein complex resource ComplexPortal - manually curated, encyclopaedic resource macro-molecular complexes hu.MAP2 - human protein complex map COMPARTMENTS - subcellular compartment database DepMap/Project Score - Databases effects cancer cell line viability elicited CRISPR-Cas9 mediated gene activation Genetic determinants survival cancer - Resource relative prognostic impact gene mutation, expression, methylation, CNA human cancers Predicted synthetic lethality interactions - Resource predicted synthetic lethality interactions human gene paralogs (using human cancer cell lines)

title: Annotation resources

title: Annotation resources

title: Annotation resources
text: assign three confidence levels respect genes oncogenic /tumor suppressive roles Strong_support (> 20 citations) biomedical literature (CancerMine), curated entry Network Cancer Genes (NCG) Cancer Gene Census (CGC), Manually curated entry NCG CGC, significant support (> 10 citations) biomedical literature (CancerMine) Curated entry NCG CGC, moderate support (<= 10 citations, > 5 citations) biomedical literature (CancerMine), Significant support (> 10 citations, <= 20 citations) biomedical literature (CancerMine), entry CGC/NCG Curated entry NCG/CGC, weak support (<= 5 citations) biomedical literature (CancerMine), Moderate support (<= 10 citations, > 5 citations) biomedical literature (CancerMine), entry CGC/NCG Literature support tumor suppressive role ignored gene 2.5 times much literature support oncogenic role (vice versa) Classification genes potential cancer drivers require support least two following sources: Network Cancer Genes - canonical cancer drivers IntOGen - predicted cancer driver genes Cancer Gene Census - TIER1/2 - curated cancer genes TCGA’s predicted cancer driver genes CancerMine - literature mining resource, considering entries support > 5 citations)

title: Input
text: main input oncoEnrichR list human genes, typically top ranked hits high-throughput screen. gene list can provided using following identifiers: Primary gene symbols (e.g. KRAS) Entrez gene IDs (e.g. 3845) Uniprot accessions (e.g. P01116) Ensembl gene identifiers (e.g. ENSG00000133703) Ensembl transcript identifiers (e.g. ENST00000311936) Ensembl protein identifiers (e.g. ENSP00000308495) RefSeq transcript identifiers (e.g. NM_004985) RefSeq peptide identifiers (e.g. NP_004976) type identifier used specified using --query_id_type argument. Similarly, background gene set specified (--bgset argument, use enrichment analysis), identifier type set --bgset_id_type argument. user submits gene symbols longer considered primary gene symbols, oncoEnrichR attempts map cases synonyms/aliases primary gene symbols.

title: Input
text: order keep size HTML output report manageable level, currently upper limit n = 1000 genes can used input tool. Please also note tool requires n = 2 input genes bare minimum, although analysis modules included/run genes input. IMPORTANT NOTE: Due large size, HTML report can slow load generating full reports maximum number genes (n = 1000). generally recommend use oncoEnrichR smaller querysets (order 100-600), produce reports can efficiently loaded viewed. want submit query pushes limit (n = 1000), recommend carefully configure report contents/modules, sense producing managable reports.

title: Installation
text: oncoEnrichR requires R (>=4.1)

what: Installation of oncoEnrichR with R commands
title: Installation
text: install.packages('devtools') devtools::install_github('sigven/oncoEnrichR', ref = "v1.4.1") library(oncoEnrichR)

title: Running
text: oncoEnrichR performs operations following three functions:

title: Running
text: Loads underlying annotation data repository oncoEnrichR, saves local cache directory. Utilizing googledrive R package

title: Running
text: Consists two main processing steps: 1) Takes input/query list human gene/protein identifiers (e.g. UniProt accession, RefSeq/Ensembl transcript identifer etc.) input conducts uniform identifier conversion 2) Performs extensive annotation, enrichment membership analyses query set underlying data sources cancer-relevant properties human genes interrelationships. Technically, method returns list object contents analyses performed. specific arguments/options default values outlined : See detailed descriptions options
code: onco_enrich(   query = NULL,   oeDB = NULL,   query_id_type = "symbol",   ignore_id_err = TRUE,   html_floating_toc = T,   html_report_theme = "default",   project_title = "_Project title_",   project_owner = "_Project owner_",   project_description = "_Project description_",   bgset = NULL,   bgset_id_type = "symbol",   bgset_description = "All protein-coding genes",   enrichment_p_value_cutoff = 0.05,   enrichment_p_value_adj = "BH",   enrichment_q_value_cutoff = 0.2,   enrichment_min_geneset_size = 10,   enrichment_max_geneset_size = 500,   enrichment_plot_num_terms = 20,   enrichment_simplify_go = TRUE,   subcellcomp_min_confidence = 3,   subcellcomp_min_channels = 1,   subcellcomp_show_cytosol = FALSE,   regulatory_min_confidence = "D",   fitness_max_score = -2,   ppi_add_nodes = 30,   ppi_string_min_score = 0.9,   ppi_string_network_type = "functional",   ppi_biogrid_min_evidence = 3,   ppi_node_shadow = TRUE,   ppi_show_drugs = TRUE,   ppi_show_isolated_nodes = FALSE,   show_ppi = TRUE,   show_disease = TRUE,   show_top_diseases_only = TRUE,   show_cancer_hallmarks = TRUE,   show_drug = TRUE,   show_enrichment = TRUE,   show_aberration = TRUE,   show_coexpression = TRUE,   show_cell_tissue = FALSE,   show_ligand_receptor = TRUE,   show_regulatory = TRUE,   show_unknown_function = TRUE,   show_prognostic = TRUE,   show_subcell_comp = TRUE,   show_synleth = TRUE,   show_fitness = TRUE,   show_complex = TRUE,   show_domain = TRUE)

title: Running
text: Consists two main processing steps: 1) Transformation raw analysis results returned oncoEnrichR::onco_enrich() various visualizations interactive tables 2) Assembly generation final analysis report ) structured interactive oncoEnrichR HTML report B) multisheet Excel workbook

title: Running
text: target list n = 134 high-confidence interacting proteins c-MYC oncoprotein previously identified BioID protein proximity assay standard cell culture tumor xenografts (Dingar et al., J Proteomics, 2015). ran target list oncoEnrichR analysis workflow using following configurations onco_enrich method: project_title = "cMYC_BioID_screen" project_owner = "Raught et al." produced following HTML report results. R commands provided reproduce example output. NOTE: Replace “LOCAL_FOLDER” directory local computer: library(oncoEnrichR) myc_interact_targets <- read.csv(system.file("extdata","myc_data.csv", package = "oncoEnrichR"), stringsAsFactors = F) oeDB <- oncoEnrichR::load_db(cache_dir = "LOCAL_FOLDER") myc_report <- oncoEnrichR::onco_enrich(query = myc_interact_targets$symbol, oeDB = oeDB, show_cell_tissue = T, project_title = "cMYC_BioID_screen", project_owner = "Raught et al.") oncoEnrichR::write(report = myc_report, oeDB = oeDB, file = "LOCAL_FOLDER/myc_report_oncoenrichr.html", format = "html") oncoEnrichR::write(report = myc_report, oeDB = oeDB, file = "LOCAL_FOLDER/myc_report_oncoenrichr.xlsx", format = "excel")

Bernal and Eivind Hovig and Jørgen Wesche},   year = {2021},   eprint = {2107.13247v2},   archiveprefix = {arXiv},   primaryclass = {q-bio.GN},   url = {https://arxiv.org/abs/2107.13247v2}, }

title: Cancer-dedicated gene set interpretation
text: oncoEnrichR R package functional interrogation human genesets context cancer. primarily intended exploratory analysis, interpretation, prioritization long gene lists, represent common output many types high-throughput cancer biology screens. oncoEnrichR can used interrogate results e.g. genetic screens (siRNA/CRISPR), protein proximity labeling, transcriptomics (differential expression). tool queries variety high-quality data resources order assemble useful gene annotations analyses interactive report (examples report shown ). Web-based access oncoEnrichR available  https://oncotools.elixir.

title: Cancer-dedicated gene set interpretation
text: contents analysis report provided oncoEnrichR address following scientific questions given gene list: diseases/tumor types known associated genes query set, extent? genes query set known oncogenic tumor suppressive roles, using evidence biomedical literature curated resources? genes query set attributed cancer hallmark evidence? proteins query sets druggable different cancer conditions (early late clinical development phases)? proteins query set, likelihood druggable? protein complexes involve proteins query set? subcellular compartments (nucleus, cytosol, plasma membrane etc) dominant localizations proteins query set? specific tissues cell types enriched query set, considering tissue/cell-type specific expression patterns target genes? protein-protein interactions known within query set? interactions members query set cancer-relevant proteins (e.g. proto-oncogenes, tumor-suppressors predicted cancer drivers)? proteins constitute hubs protein-protein interaction network? known regulatory interactions (TF-target) found within query set, mode regulation (repressive vs. stimulating)? occurrences known ligand-receptor interactions within query set? specific pathways, biological processes, pre-defined molecular signatures enriched within query set, compared reference/background set? members query set frequently mutated tumor sample cohorts (TCGA, SNVs/InDels, homozygous deletions, copy number amplifications)? members query set co-expressed (strong negative positive correlations) cancer-relevant genes (.e. proto-oncogenes tumor suppressors) tumor sample cohorts (TCGA)? members query set associated better/worse survival different cancers, considering high low gene expression levels, mutation, copy number status tumors? members query set predicted partners synthetic lethality interactions? members query set associated cellular loss--fitness CRISPR/Cas9 whole-genome drop screens cancer cell lines (.e. reduction cell viability elicited gene inactivation)? targets prioritized therapeutic targets, considering fitness effects genomic biomarkers combination? See also output views addresses questions .

code: init_report(   oeDB,   project_title = "_Project title_",   project_owner = "_Project owner_",   html_floating_toc = T,   html_report_theme = "default",   query_id_type = "symbol",   ignore_id_err = TRUE,   project_description = "_Project description_",   ppi_string_min_score = 0.9,   ppi_string_network_type = "functional",   ppi_biogrid_min_evidence = 3,   ppi_add_nodes = 30,   ppi_show_isolated_nodes = FALSE,   ppi_node_shadow = TRUE,   ppi_show_drugs = T,   bgset_description = "All annotated protein-coding genes",   bgset_id_type = "symbol",   enrichment_p_value_cutoff = 0.05,   enrichment_p_value_adj = "BH",   enrichment_q_value_cutoff = 0.2,   enrichment_min_geneset_size = 10,   enrichment_max_geneset_size = 500,   enrichment_plot_num_terms = 20,   enrichment_simplify_go = F,   subcellcomp_min_confidence = 3,   subcellcomp_min_channels = 1,   subcellcomp_show_cytosol = F,   regulatory_min_confidence = "D",   fitness_max_score = -2,   show_ppi = T,   show_disease = T,   show_top_diseases_only = T,   show_cancer_hallmarks = T,   show_drug = T,   show_enrichment = T,   show_aberration = T,   show_coexpression = T,   show_subcell_comp = T,   show_fitness = T,   show_cell_tissue = F,   show_ligand_receptor = T,   show_regulatory = T,   show_unknown_function = T,   show_prognostic = T,   show_synleth = T,   show_complex = T,   show_domain = T )

title: Load oncoEnrichR annotation database — init_report
text: oeDB oncoEnrichR annotation database object project_title project title (title report) project_owner name project owner html_floating_toc logical - float table contents left main document content. floating table contents always visible even document scrolled html_report_theme Bootswatch theme HTML report ("bootstrap","cerulean","cosmo","default","flatly","journal","lumen","paper","sandstone","simplex","spacelab","united","yeti") query_id_type character indicating source query (one "uniprot_acc", "symbol", "entrezgene", "ensembl_gene","ensembl_mrna","refseq_mrna","ensembl_protein","refseq_protein") ignore_id_err logical indicating analysis continue uknown query identifiers encountered project_description project background information ppi_string_min_score minimum score (0 1) confidence retrieved protein-protein interactions (STRING) ppi_string_network_type STRING network type ('physical' 'functional') ppi_biogrid_min_evidence minimum number evidence items protein-protein interactions shown (BIOGRID) ppi_add_nodes number nodes add target set computing protein-protein interaction network (STRING/BIOGRID) ppi_show_isolated_nodes logical indicating targets/nodes without interactions displayed protein-protein interaction network ppi_node_shadow show shadow nodes displayed PPI network (STRING/BIOGRID) ppi_show_drugs logical indicating targeted drugs (> phase 3) displayed protein-protein interaction network bgset_description character indicating type background (e.g. "lipid-binding proteins (n = 200)") bgset_id_type character indicating source query (one "uniprot_acc", "symbol", "entrezgene", "ensembl_gene","ensembl_mrna","refseq_mrna","ensembl_protein","refseq_protein") enrichment_p_value_cutoff cutoff p-value enrichment/-representation analysis enrichment_p_value_adj one "holm", "hochberg", "hommel", "bonferroni", "BH", "", "fdr", "none" enrichment_q_value_cutoff cutoff q-value enrichment analysis enrichment_min_geneset_size minimal size geneset annotated term testing enrichment/-representation analysis enrichment_max_geneset_size maximal size geneset annotated term testing enrichment/-representation analysis enrichment_plot_num_terms number top enriched Gene Ontology terms (max) show enrichment barplot enrichment_simplify_go remove highly similar GO terms results GO enrichment/-representation analysis subcellcomp_min_confidence minimun confidence level subcellular compartment annotation COMPARTMENTS (min = 3, max = 5) subcellcomp_min_channels minimum number channels support subcellular annotation COMPARTMENTS subcellcomp_show_cytosol logical indicating subcellular heatmap highlight cytosol subcellular protein location regulatory_min_confidence minimum confidence level regulatory interactions (TF-target) retrieved DoRothEA ('','B','C', 'D') fitness_max_score maximum loss--fitness score (scaled Bayes factor BAGEL) genes retrieved Project Score show_ppi logical indicating report contain protein-protein interaction data (STRING) show_disease logical indicating report contain disease associations (Open Targets Platform, association_score >= 0.05, support least two data types) show_top_diseases_only logical indicating report contain top (n = 20) disease associations pr. query gene (Open Targets Platform) show_cancer_hallmarks logical indicating report contain annotations/evidence cancer hallmarks per query gene (COSMIC/Open Targets Platform) show_drug logical indicating report contain targeted cancer drug information show_enrichment logical indicating report contain functional enrichment/-representation analysis (MSigDB, GO, KEGG, REACTOME, NetPath, WikiPathways) show_aberration logical indicating report contain TCGA aberration plots (amplifications/deletions) show_coexpression logical indicating report contain TCGA co-expression data (RNAseq) query set oncogenes/tumor suppressor genes show_subcell_comp logical indicating report provide subcellular compartment annotations (COMPARTMENTS) show_fitness logical indicating report provide fitness scores target priority scores CRISPR/Cas9 loss--fitness screens (Project Score) show_cell_tissue logical indicating report contain tissue-specificity single cell-type specificity assessments (Human Protein Atlas) target genes, using data Human Protein Atlas show_ligand_receptor logical indicating report contain ligand-receptor interactions (CellChatDB) show_regulatory logical indicating report contain data transcription factor (TF) - target interactions relevant query set (DoRothEA) show_unknown_function logical indicating report highlight target genes unknown poorly defined functions (GO/Uniprot KB/NCBI) show_prognostic logical indicating mRNA-based (single-gene) prognostic associations cancer types listed (Human Protein Atlas/TCGA) show_synleth logical indicating report list overlap predicted synthetic lethality interactions (gene paralogs , De Kegel et al., Cell Systems, 2021) show_complex logical indicating report provide target memberships known protein complexes (ComplexPortal/Compleat/PDB/CORUM) show_domain logical indicating report provide target memberships known protein domains (Pfam) remote TRUE (default), load database version-tagged Zenodo repository cache_dir path local cache efficient subsequent loads

title: Load oncoEnrichR data repository — load_db
text: Function fetches version-tagged oncoEnrichR data repository Google Drive

title: Load oncoEnrichR data repository — load_db
code: load_db(cache_dir = NA, force_download = FALSE, googledrive = TRUE)

title: Load oncoEnrichR data repository — load_db
text: cache_dir Local directory data download force_download Logical indicating local cache force download (.e. set TRUE re-download even data exists cache) googledrive logical indicating use googledrive UiO server host downloading

title: Load oncoEnrichR data repository — load_db
text: list object oncoEnrichR datasets, used oeDB argument onco_enrich() write()

what: Interrogate a gene list for cancer relevance — onco_enrich
title: Interrogate a gene list for cancer relevance — onco_enrich
text: Function interrogates list human gene identifiers cancer relevance. Multiple perspectives offered, including tumor aberration co-expression patterns, druggability, protein-protein interactions, gene fitness effects, regulatory interactions, subcellular compartment enrichment, pathway enrichment, synthetic lethality interactions, prognostic associations, .

title: Interrogate a gene list for cancer relevance — onco_enrich
code: onco_enrich(   query = NULL,   oeDB = NULL,   query_id_type = "symbol",   ignore_id_err = TRUE,   html_floating_toc = T,   html_report_theme = "default",   project_title = "_Project title_",   project_owner = "_Project owner_",   project_description = "_Project description_",   bgset = NULL,   bgset_id_type = "symbol",   bgset_description = "All protein-coding genes",   enrichment_p_value_cutoff = 0.05,   enrichment_p_value_adj = "BH",   enrichment_q_value_cutoff = 0.2,   enrichment_min_geneset_size = 10,   enrichment_max_geneset_size = 500,   enrichment_plot_num_terms = 20,   enrichment_simplify_go = TRUE,   subcellcomp_min_confidence = 3,   subcellcomp_min_channels = 1,   subcellcomp_show_cytosol = FALSE,   regulatory_min_confidence = "D",   fitness_max_score = -2,   ppi_add_nodes = 30,   ppi_string_min_score = 0.9,   ppi_string_network_type = "functional",   ppi_biogrid_min_evidence = 3,   ppi_node_shadow = TRUE,   ppi_show_drugs = TRUE,   ppi_show_isolated_nodes = FALSE,   show_ppi = TRUE,   show_disease = TRUE,   show_top_diseases_only = TRUE,   show_cancer_hallmarks = TRUE,   show_drug = TRUE,   show_enrichment = TRUE,   show_aberration = TRUE,   show_coexpression = TRUE,   show_cell_tissue = FALSE,   show_ligand_receptor = TRUE,   show_regulatory = TRUE,   show_unknown_function = TRUE,   show_prognostic = TRUE,   show_subcell_comp = TRUE,   show_synleth = TRUE,   show_fitness = TRUE,   show_complex = TRUE,   show_domain = TRUE,   ... )

title: Interrogate a gene list for cancer relevance — onco_enrich
text: query character vector gene/query identifiers (minimum 2, maximum 1000) oeDB oncoEnrichR data repository object - returned load_db() query_id_type character indicating source query (one "uniprot_acc", "symbol","entrezgene", "ensembl_gene", "ensembl_mrna", "refseq_mrna", "ensembl_protein", "refseq_protein") ignore_id_err logical indicating analysis continue uknown query identifiers encountered html_floating_toc logical - float table contents left main document content (HTML report). floating table contents always visible even document scrolled html_report_theme Bootswatch theme HTML report ("bootstrap", "cerulean", "cosmo", "default", "flatly", "journal", "lumen", "paper", "sandstone", "simplex", "spacelab", "united", "yeti") project_title project title (title report) project_owner name project owner project_description project background information bgset character vector gene identifiers, used reference/background enrichment/-representation analysis bgset_id_type character indicating source background ("uniprot_acc", "symbol", "entrezgene", "ensembl_gene", "ensembl_mrna", "refseq_mrna", "ensembl_protein", "refseq_protein"), default: "symbol" bgset_description character indicating type background (e.g. "lipid-binding proteins (n = 200)") enrichment_p_value_cutoff cutoff p-value enrichment/ -representation analysis (default: 0.05) enrichment_p_value_adj one "holm", "hochberg", "hommel", "bonferroni", "BH", "", "fdr", "none" (clusterProfiler, default: "BH") enrichment_q_value_cutoff cutoff q-value enrichment analysis (clusterProfiler, default: 0.2) enrichment_min_geneset_size minimal size geneset annotated term testing enrichment/-representation analysis (clusterProfiler, default: 10) enrichment_max_geneset_size maximal size geneset annotated term testing enrichment/-representation analysis (clusterProfiler, default: 500) enrichment_plot_num_terms number top enriched Gene Ontology terms (max) show enrichment barplot (default: 15) enrichment_simplify_go remove highly similar GO terms results GO enrichment/-representation analysis (default: TRUE) subcellcomp_min_confidence minimum confidence level subcellular compartment annotation COMPARTMENTS (min = 3, max = 5, default: 3) subcellcomp_min_channels minimum number channels support subcellular compartment annotation COMPARTMENTS (min = 1, max = 3, default: 1) subcellcomp_show_cytosol logical indicating subcellular heatmap show highlight proteins located cytosol (default: FALSE) regulatory_min_confidence minimum confidence level regulatory interactions (TF-target) retrieved DoRothEA ('','B','C', 'D', default: 'D') fitness_max_score maximum loss--fitness score (scaled Bayes factor BAGEL) genes retrieved DepMap/Project Score, default:-2 ppi_add_nodes number nodes add target set computing protein-protein interaction network (STRING/BioGRID, default: 30) ppi_string_min_score minimum score (0 1) confidence retrieved protein-protein interactions (STRING, default: 0.9) ppi_string_network_type type network show interactions STRING ('functional' 'physical', default: 'functional') ppi_biogrid_min_evidence minimum number evidence items required protein-protein interactions retrieved (BioGRID, default: 3) ppi_node_shadow show shadow nodes displayed PPI network (default: TRUE) ppi_show_drugs logical indicating targeted drugs (>= phase 3) displayed protein-protein interaction networks (default: TRUE) ppi_show_isolated_nodes logical indicating targets/nodes without interactions displayed protein-protein interaction networks (default: FALSE) show_ppi logical indicating report contain protein-protein interaction views query set (STRING BioGRID, default: TRUE) show_disease logical indicating report contain disease associations (Open Targets Platform, association_score >= 0.05, support least two data types), tumor suppressor/oncogene annotations ( default: TRUE) show_top_diseases_only logical indicating report contain top (n = 20) disease associations pr. query gene default: TRUE) show_cancer_hallmarks logical indicating report contain annotations/evidence cancer hallmarks per query gene (COSMIC/Open Targets Platform, default: TRUE show_drug logical indicating report contain targeted cancer drug information (default: TRUE) show_enrichment logical indicating report contain functional enrichment/-representation analysis (MSigDB, GO, KEGG, REACTOME, NetPath, WikiPathways, default: TRUE) show_aberration logical indicating report contain TCGA aberration plots (amplifications/deletions, default: TRUE) show_coexpression logical indicating report contain TCGA co-expression data (RNAseq) query set oncogenes/tumor suppressor genes (default: TRUE) show_cell_tissue logical indicating report contain tissue-specificity single cell-type specificity assessments (Human Protein Atlas) target genes (default: FALSE) show_ligand_receptor logical indicating report contain ligand-receptor interactions (CellChatDB, default: TRUE) show_regulatory logical indicating report contain data transcription factor (TF) - target interactions relevant query set (DoRothEA, default: TRUE) show_unknown_function logical indicating report highlight target genes unknown poorly defined functions (GO/Uniprot KB/NCBI, default: TRUE) show_prognostic logical indicating mRNA-based (single-gene) prognostic associations cancer types listed (Human Protein Atlas/TCGA, default: TRUE show_subcell_comp logical indicating report provide subcellular compartment annotations (COMPARTMENTS, default: TRUE) show_synleth logical indicating report list overlap predicted synthetic lethality interactions (gene paralogs , De Kegel et al., Cell Systems, 2021). Default: TRUE show_fitness logical indicating report provide fitness scores target priority scores CRISPR/Cas9 loss--fitness screens (DepMap/Project Score, default: TRUE) show_complex logical indicating report provide target memberships known protein complexes (ComplexPortal/Compleat/hu.MAP2/PDB/CORUM, default: TRUE) show_domain logical indicating report provide target memberships known protein domains (Pfam, default: TRUE) ... arguments Galaxy/web-based processing

what: Write oncoEnrichR report object to output file — write
title: Write oncoEnrichR report object to output file — write
text: Function writes oncoEnrichR report object file, either interactive HTML report Excel workbook.

title: Write oncoEnrichR report object to output file — write
code: write(   report,   oeDB,   file = "testReport.html",   ignore_file_extension = F,   overwrite = F,   format = "html",   ... )

title: Write oncoEnrichR report object to output file — write
text: report object oncoEnrichR report data (returned oeDB$onco_enrich) oeDB oncoEnrichR data repository object - returned load_db() file full filename report output (e.g. "oe_report.html" "oe_report.xlsx") ignore_file_extension logical accept type filaname extensions (Galaxy integration) overwrite logical indicating existing output files may overwritten format file format output (html/excel) ... options Galaxy/non self-contained HTML. applicable use Galaxy
